results.content: I learned more than I expected to. Though I had hoped to learn how to get a server like XAMPP running in order to test the php. Knowing this was assumed in this class. But otherwise it's a solid class on learning to build an airtight contact form. I'm wiser for taking it!

results.content:
I consider the purchase of this course a mistake for the following reasons:
- it's conducted in such a manner, that it makes coding along harder as it should be
- the source code doesn't contain any comments (at all!). This is particularly bad since this is written for students trying to learn this stuff
- he rushes over the javascript file so quickly that it doesn't really explain anything at all
- the form doesn't forward the message, but saves it to a text file.

When I uploaded all the original project files to my server, I found out that
- this text file saving doesn't work out of the box
- input validation seems to have a bug

There is a different course on the same topic at Udemy that does a much better job at helping you to write a contact form that actually works.

response.content:
Hello Toshi888, and thank you for the feedback. 
All the supplied materials are being tested and are working correctly. If you can be more precise I could help you with issues you are having.
In general the preferred style of learning is: instead of taking the precious time of the user, with long courses, to explain the basics while writing the code and having actual result.
